channel.title: Compare and Contrast Windows
channel.description: Pros, cons? Debate wether microsoft has done any work worth noting since vista and what about windows7?

item.title: Compare and Contrast Windows
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:27, topic:372621”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=468664.msg3430872#msg3430872 date=1292341615]

Silverlight is insanely more powerful than flash or java applets, with the added benefit of not requiring the use of a shitty language.

I’ll be fair, it can’t do hardware accelerated 3d rendering like java can with OpenGL…yet.

When did Java and AS 3.0 (2.0 is shitty yes) become shitty languages?
The only site I have seen that use Silverlight use it on videos as an alternative to WMP, so it may be good, but where did it get used?

AS 3.0 is shitty
[/quote]
if(“better performance and making the language standardized” == “shit”){
(“AS 2.0 is better than AS 3.0”) = true;
}[/quote]
i know of quite a few professionals in the industry that think AS 3.0 is shitty and they prefer 2.0. And its not even that they started with 2.0 and were set in their ways a lot of them know 3.0 and just generally do not like it. I think they probably know more than you, subsequently that was a faggotish response

Read full topic

item.title: Compare and Contrast Windows
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“nade, post:23, topic:372621”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=468664.msg3430069#msg3430069 date=1292267679]

You know what was awesome? SilverLight.

We already had that years ago, and it was called flash, and it ran on all operating systems, including mobile phones. And while it is buggy sometimes, it’s still less buggy and better than silverlight.
[/quote]

Sarcasm. Silver light was horrible. Though, flash wasn’t any better. Hate flash.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:
@tL wrote:

I don’t know… most of the uses I’ve seen of SilverLight have been more efficient, less buggy and smoother than the flash equivalent. That is only within the last year or two though, maybe it was shit back when it first came out, but i never paid much attention to it then.

item.title: Compare and Contrast Windows
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:12, topic:372621”]I have always been a fan of fedora and ubuntu, though windows 7 has been great for me so far. Good operating system.

I don’t use IE, I stick to Chrome, but the html5 demos on the technical preview of ie9 were quite impressive.[/quote]

IE uses stupid proprietary shit and is the reason web development isn’t as advanced as it could be.

If you’re using Chrome or any other browser, chances are you see HTML5 shit every day of your life and you don’t even notice it.

http://caniuse.com/#show_conc=1

IE 9 will blow, and STILL isn’t up to web standards. Not to mention, you’ll need their newest OS to run it, when something like Chrome will run back to Windows XP and give you all the functionality and more.

Read full topic
